pullRequest.title: Github Autolabeler Action
pullRequest.bodyText:
As mentioned in #1277, several of us thought that it would be a good idea to autolabel PRs with the source project affected or other various metadata - an example of "other metadata" that I chose was bash for all shell scripts, which arguably could have been just "shell".
I'm open to any and all suggested changes on this, or additions of new sections. I'm somewhat new to the project, so it's entirely possible that I mislabeled something.
I also wasn't sure when adding a new file if I needed to add the license header or if some form of automation would do that for me - I suppose I'll find out 🙂
In the course of working on this, it also occurred to me that there's an official YAML linter action which we might also consider, given that I had to catch by eye several small mistakes that I made. I'll open up another issue for that.

commit.message: Add in basic autolabeler github action
Add in missing quotes from yaml - we should definitely consider the yaml linter
Give credit to spark project for the top level doc comment
Sentence syntax for the comment crediting spark project

nodes.bodyText: Do I need to add the ASF iceberg license at the top of the file manually or will that happen on merge or in some other way?
Yes,  I think we should attach the license header in this file manually.
This project doesn't use maven. Should we remove this? And what about the files that are also in .gitignore?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"

nodes.bodyText: These two look like they can be removed as well.

commit.message: add the asf license file header
address some more PR feedback on keeping mkdocs.yaml in docs and out of infrastructure
Only match on top level directories, not subdirectories
label any file with gradle in the name as BUILD and include the gradle version dependencies properties file
theres no need for the top level gradle folder rule as it will be matched by the all files or directories containing gradle rule
Make the license comment a valid YAML comment and then use a leading slash to match files and directories below top level folders
Leave an empty line between the license header and file contents

nodes.bodyText: I thought dev was going to be part of "infra", so we can remove "bash" altogether.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+#
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+#
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+#
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/**"
+  - ".github/**"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev"
+  - "**gradle**"
+  - "versions.props"
+BASH:
+  - "/dev"

commit.message: Merge branch 'autolabeler-github-action' of github.com:kbendick/iceberg into autolabeler-github-action
move dev directory from build to infra
use leading slash notation for top level folders starting with a . now that its tested in my own fork
